emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Autonomous Energy Networks (DAEN)
emerging_technologies.description: A network where energy production, distribution, and consumption are managed autonomously through blockchain, optimizing energy use and rewarding participants with tokens.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces energy waste, promotes local energy production, and could democratize energy access, reducing dependency on large utility companies.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires widespread adoption of smart meters, regulatory approval for decentralized energy trading, and consumer trust in blockchain technology.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Identity Exchange (NIX)
emerging_technologies.description: A platform where neural data can be securely traded or shared, with identity verification and memory tokenization for cognitive enhancements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to a market for cognitive abilities but raises privacy and security concerns regarding personal data.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ethical considerations, legal frameworks for neural data, and the maturity of neural interface technology.

emerging_technologies.name: AI-Enhanced Space Mining Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts on the blockchain for managing space mining operations, ensuring transparent governance and profit distribution.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes interplanetary resource exploitation but necessitates international agreements on space law.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Development of reliable AI systems for space operations, space law, and investor interest in space mining.

mainstream_technologies.name: Tokenized Green Energy Certificates
mainstream_technologies.description: Certificates representing renewable energy production, tradable on blockchain platforms to incentivize green energy production.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted by energy companies and environmental organizations to track and verify green energy credits.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Transport Networks
mainstream_technologies.description: A blockchain-based system for autonomous vehicle fleets to operate independently, reducing the need for centralized transport management.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integrated into urban planning in several smart cities, with significant investment from tech and automotive industries.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems where economic transactions, governance, and resource management are handled by decentralized networks.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Enhances local control over resources, potentially increases economic resilience, but challenges traditional governance structures.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rise in blockchain technology adoption, increasing emphasis on sustainability, and a growing distrust in centralized systems.

epoch_themes.description: Exploration and commercialization of cognitive capabilities and space resources, driven by advancements in AI, neural tech, and space exploration.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Could revolutionize education, work, and human expansion into space, but also brings ethical and security concerns.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing investment in space travel, growth of the neurotech market, and a push towards personal data sovereignty.
